Original_notes: alternation of potatoes and semsem "not (for) rotation of crops", but because semsem requires weed-free land
(+); ivory-carvers; canoe and shield makers; cf. (Roscoe 1911: 406)
cow, cowry shell; blue bead; ivory disc
sub-infeudation, all land ultimately the King’s
(-); he virtually a law unto himself, but there is no evidence that general laws were promulgated by him
chosen ad hoc with advice of war gods; [for pre-Mutesa period, i.e. before 1854]

King Mutesa (1854-1884) instituted a standing army with professional officers. Roscoe makes no comment on the extent of stimulus from European contacts, but to minimize diffused traits this is scored for the period pre-Mutesa
